B1Ez6J1uY.content:
*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

H19SB-k_Y.content:
# Notes

* To draw a new circle, send a pulse to the UPD pin of the draw-circle node.
* To blank the screen, send a pulse to the UPD pin of the fill-screen node.

@/01-example.description: Draw a circle and then edit its appearance using the tweak nodes. Run in debugger.

H16z1eJuY.content:
*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

@/04-example.description: Demonstration of some of the shapes and patterns that can be drawn on the LCD. Move the 5-way switch left or right to navigate through the examples.

r1-byxydt.content:
*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

@/03-example.description: Level. Check that a surface is horizontal using the Wio Terminal. On the LCD you will see a fixed cyan ring and a moveable yellow circle. When the yellow circle is inside the cyan ring, the surface on which the Wio Terminal is resting is horizontal.

*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

@/07-example.description: Patch for testing all nodes that create sprite graphics.

H1YzwheojdF.content: # Navigate through the sample images using the 5-way-switch.

B12OZpfYF.content:
The 16 bit images used in this example can be found in: 
https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-wio-terminal/raw/main/images/bmp/rgb565_example_images.zip

An SD card containing these images must be inserted into the Wio Terminal before running this patch.

H1r77aMYF.content:
*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

SyWFrazFt.content:
The *load-image* node requires a "special" 16-bit bmp file format. Full instructions for preparing image files can be found here:
https://wiki.seeedstudio.com/Wio-Terminal-LCD-Loading-Image/#image-format-configuration

@/05-example.description: Patch to demonstrate loading of images.

@/08-example.description: Patch to  demonstrate the appearance of all fonts in the wayland/wio-terminal-fonts library.

@/02-example.description: Motion detector. Detect sudden movements (clicks/taps) using the Wio Terminal's inbuilt inertial measurement unit. Screen is green until motion is detected at which point it turns red. Use button A on the Wio Terminal to reset the detector.

SyYAAp1Zc.content:
*To use the Wio Terminal with XOD, you will need to add the following line to* ``` xod/__packages__/extra.txt ```:
*https://files.seeedstudio.com/arduino/package_seeeduino_boards_index.json*

SklY00TkW5.content:
The *load-image* node requires a "special" 16-bit bmp file format. Full instructions for preparing image files can be found here:
https://wiki.seeedstudio.com/Wio-Terminal-LCD-Loading-Image/#image-format-configuration

The 16 bit image (xod_logo.bmp) used in this example can be found in: https://github.com/WaylandM/xod-wio-terminal/tree/main/images/bmp/rgb565 

An SD card containing these images must be inserted into the Wio Terminal before running this patch.

@/06-example.description: Patch to demonstrate loading an image into a sprite. The image is initially displayed without rotation, then after 2 seconds it is rotated through 30.

@/push-rotated-sprite.description: Push a rotated copy of the sprite to the LCD.

@/set-pivot.description: Set the pivot point on the LCD.

@/wt-sprite.description: Create a sprite. A sprite is stored in RAM and can be rendered to the LCD using either push-sprite or push-rotated-sprite.

Skx3z9-UY.description: Rotation. Options: 00h (0), 01h (90), 02h (180) and 03h (270). N.B. the lcd-device node sets the rotation to 03h (270) as this is the most commonly used orientation.
Skx3z9-UY.label: Rotate

@/push-sprite.description: Push the sprite to the LCD at the coordinates X, Y.

description: Library to drive the LCD of the Wio Terminal. Partially wraps https://github.com/Seeed-Studio/Seeed_Arduino_LCD
name: wio-terminal-lcd
